Enter one new State/Region per line.

AK,Alaska
AZ,Arizona
AR,Arkansas

.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.AdminEditUserDeactivateUser_Help
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A Deactivated User will not be able to sign in, and will not appear in default User Management views. Deactivating a user account instead of deleting it also has the benefit of preventing a user from re-registering using the same email and/or username in the future..

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.AdminEditUserStatusVerified_Help
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to When the “Verify User Email” system preference is enabled (by default), new users will not be able to sign in until they verify their email address. member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

Enter new category names in a comma separated format. They will appear as sub-categories of the category selected above. New 'top' level categories should be added to the (Root).

Example: Athletic Apparel, Coats & Jackets, Dresses, Intimates & Sleep, Pants & Shorts, Skirts, Suits & Blazers, Sweaters, Tops & Blouses

If you will be translating the software into multiple languages, each category name will represent the 'key' in the key/value pair. Do not use spaces or [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.FinalBuyerFee
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Buyer Final Fee.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.FinalBuyerFeeStyle_Aggregate
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Aggregate %.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.FinalBuyerFeeStyle_Aggregate_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to With the Buyer Final Fee tiers set to the following values...

$25.00 = 5%

$100.00 = 2.5%

$999,999,999,999.00 = 1.0%

If an item sells with a final price of $125.00 the Buyer Final Fee is calculated as follows:

($25.00 x 5.0%) + ($75.00 x 2.5%) + ( $25.00 x 1.0%) = $3.38 Buyer Final Fee

If an item sells with a final price of $99.00 the Buyer Final Fee is calculated as follows:

($25.00 x 5.0%) + ($74.00 x [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.FinalbuyerFeeStyle_Flat
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Flat Fee.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.FinalBuyerFeeStyle_Flat_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to With the Buyer Final Fee tiers set to the following values...

$25.00 = $1.00

$100.00 = $5.00

$999,999,999,999.00 = $10.00

If an item sells with a final price of $125.00 the Buyer Final Fee is $10.00

If an item sells with a final price of $99.00 the Buyer Final Fee is $5.00.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.FinalBuyerFeeStyle_NonAggregate
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Non-aggregate %.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.FinalBuyerFeeStyle_NonAggregate_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to With the Buyer Final Fee tiers set to the following values...

$25.00 = 5%

$100.00 = 2.5%

$999,999,999,999.00 = 1.0%

If an item sells with a final price of $125.00 the Buyer Final Fee is calculated as follows:

($125.00 x 1.0%) = $1.25

If an item sells with a final price of $99.00 the Buyer Final Fee is calculated as follows:

($99.00 x 2.5%) = $2.48.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.FinalBuyerFee_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Unlike most other site fees, this fee will be added to the buyer's "Site Fee Invoice" instead of the seller's "Site Fee Invoice".

Note: This fee can be used independently from the "Buyer's Premium" feature, which allows the seller to specify a % to be added to the Sale Invoice for each sale.

To disable 'Buyer Final Fee' set all tiers to $0 or 0%..

$25.00 = 5%

$100.00 = 2.5%

$999,999,999,999.00 = 1.0%

If an item sells with a final price of $125.00 the Seller Final fee is calculated as follows:

($25.00 x 5.0%) + ($75.00 x 2.5%) + ( $25.00 x 1.0%) = $3.38 Seller Final fee

If an item sells with a final price of $99.00 the Seller Final fee is calculated as follows:

($25.00 x 5.0%) + ($74. [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Resources.AdminStrings.IncrementHelp
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

Bid increments determine the minimum valid bid amount a user may enter when placing a bid on an auction.

A user may bid any amount equal to or greater than the (Current Price) + (Bid Increment).

Increments are applied at each 'price level' up to the next defined 'price level'.

.

member.name: T:Resources.CustomFields
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.AllowInstantCheckout_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to If Enabled: Buyers will be able to checkout immediately after purchase.
If Disabled: You will be able to make adjustments to all invoices (e.g. updating shipping, tax, buyer's premium) before the buyer can complete checkout..

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.AuthorizeNet_Enabled_Help
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If Enabled: The software will connect to your Authorize.net account and "Checkout with Credit Card" will be available as a checkout option. This payment method allows users to submit credit card payments without leaving the website. Note: This payment method also requires "Stored Credit Cards" to be enabled..

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.AuthorizeNet_EnableForSellers
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Enable for Third Party Sellers.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.AuthorizeNet_EnableForSellers_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to When checked, sellers will be allowed to enter their own Authorize.Net credentials for accepting sales payments.

If un-checked, only Admin users will be able to accept credit cards for sales payments of their own listings..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Default Lot Number Format.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.DefaultLotNumberDigits_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

If a seller does not enter a lot number, one will be automatically assigned. The number assigned will be formatted with the number of characters entered in this setting.

Example:
When the default lot number digits is set to "1", the lots will be assigned a lot number starting with "1".
 
When the default number format is set to "3" the lots will be assigned a lot number starting with "001".

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.FollowAuctionLiveEnabled
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Enable Follow Auction Live.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.FollowAuctionLiveEnabled_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

As an auction event begins closing, users will have the option to "Follow Auction Live" which automatically redirects them to the next Lot closing in the current event as each lot ends.

* If enabled, every event will have its own setting to enable or disable the ability for users to “Follow Auction Live”.

Note: When enabled for an event, the system will automatically add all lots to the same auto-extend group so that each lot will close one at a time and in the proper lot order.

.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.ListingDurationOptions
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Listing Duration Options.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.ListingDurationOptions_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

Start Date & Duration – Schedule a start date and time and select the number of days (duration) the listing will be active.

Start Date & End Date – Specify both a starting and ending date and time.

Duration Only – Listing becomes active right away and ends after the number of days selected.

End Date Only – Listing becomes active immediately and ends at the specified end date and time.

.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.ProcessingEnabled
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Processing Enabled.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.ProcessingEnabled_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

If Enabled: The following background processes are enabled:

  • Starting Listings - Activates listings set to begin in the future
  • Listing Resolution - Ends and resolves listings
  • Fee Refresher - Calculates fees owed
  • Notifier - Manages sending emails

If this option is not enabled, the above processes do not run. The results are: listings never start or end, no system emai [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.ProxyBiddingBelowReserve
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Proxy Bidding Below Reserve.

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.ProxyBiddingBelowReserve_Help
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If Enabled: Proxy bidding will function the same regardless of whether the Reserve Price has been met or not, which will result in the auction ending unsuccessfully if there is only one bidder (even if their maximum proxy bid is greater than the Reserve Price). Otherwise (if disabled), the proxy system will automatically increase the bid level to meet the Reserve Price if possible..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If Enabled: non-Admin sellers will not be able to publish event immediately. The admin can also publish the event at any time by impersonating the seller and clicking the “Publish Event” dropdown option..

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.StripeConnect_EnabledForSellers_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to If Enabled: Sellers will be allowed to connect their Stripe account for accepting sales payments.

Note: If you enable this option you must also add a Connect endpoint on your stripe account. Go to "Your Account > API > Webhooks > Endpoints receiving events from your account > Add endpoint", enter the URL as "http(s)://(your website)/Stripe/WebHookHandler" and choose Live events..

member.name: P:Resources.CustomFields.StripeConnect_Enabled_Help
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If Enabled: The software will connect to your Stripe account using the Connect API and "Checkout with Credit Card" will be available as a checkout option. This payment method allows users to submit credit card payments without leaving the website. Note: this payment method allows credit cards to be saved remotely on stripe.com for use with future purchases..

member.name: P:Resources.GlobalStrings.CSVImport_Notes_PdfAttachments
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to One or more URIs to PDF file(s) to download for this listing as PDF attachments, separated by horizontal bar(s) (|). Each URI may optionally be followed by a friendly title for the attachment by adding the title in curly braces ({2}, {3}). If a friendly title is not included then the filename will be used instead. If you use file:// then your physical web root is located at "{0}". Therefore, if you are referencing files you've uploaded to your site, the value of this field would be something like "file:/ [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Resources.GlobalStrings.CSVImport_Notes_Shipping1
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Shipping options format:
{0}

(Shipping options format is a Shipping Method Id, followed by a colon ":", followed by the price for that method, optionally followed by another colon ":" and the price per additional item. This may be repeated multiple times, for multiple shipping options; however, each must be separated by a pipe "|"). Shipping Methods should not appear more than once in this value. {1} and {2} are always based on the currency specified for the Listin [rest of string was truncated]";.

{5}
.

member.name: P:Resources.GlobalStrings.FollowLiveEnabled_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

When the auction event begins closing, users will have the option to "Follow Auction Live" which automatically redirects them to the next lot closing.

IMPORTANT: To prepare the lots to close one at a time and in the proper order, by default all lots will be added to the same auto-extend group.

.

member.name: P:Resources.GlobalStrings.IncrementHelp
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

Bid increments determine the minimum valid bid amount a user may enter when placing a bid on an auction.

A user may bid any amount equal to or greater than the (Current Price) + (Bid Increment).

Increments are applied at each 'price level' up to the next defined 'price level'.

.

member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Enabled (checked) - Proxy bidding will be enabled for this auction event. Bids will automatically be entered on the bidders behalf, up to their maximum proxy bid amount.
 
When proxy bidding is not enabled, a user's maximum bid is placed immediately..

member.name: P:Resources.GlobalStrings.ProxyBidding_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

Enabled: Bids are automatically entered on behalf of the bidder for the lowest amount required to win the item.

Disabled: User's maximum bid is placed immediately when entered, and no automatic bids are placed on users' behalf.

.

member.name: P:Resources.GlobalStrings.SalesTaxShippingOption_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Indicates how shipping should be taxed.

Not Taxable: Shipping will not be taxed when this tax rate is used to calculate total sales tax.

Partially Taxable: A percentage of the shipping cost will be taxable, equivalent to the percentage of taxable items contributing to the subtotal.

Fully Taxable: The total shipping cost will be taxable..

member.name: P:Resources.GlobalStrings.ShippingOptions_Help
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to

Step 1. Select Shipping Service
Step 2. Enter COST of shipment
Step 3. Enter ADDITIONAL COST, the amount to charge for shipping this item if combined with other purchases

Notes:

  • Enter 0 under Cost to indicate free shipping.
  • Enter 0 under Additional Cost to indicate free shipping of this item when combined with other purchases.
  • When a buyer purchases multiple items, the listing with [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.summary: Handles MVC routing configuration

member.name: M:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.RouteConfig.RegisterRoutes(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Registers MVC routes

one of "default" or "browse"

member.name: T:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Areas.API.Controllers.EventController
member.summary: Provides services to Create/Update/Get/Delete Listings

member.name: M:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Areas.API.Controllers.EventController.Get(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an Event by ID
member.param: The ID of the event to get
member.returns: An HTTP Status code of 200 (OK) and the Event on success. Otherwise, HTTP Status code 404 (Not Found) if the event is not found.

member.name: M:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Areas.API.Controllers.EventController.Post(RainWorx.FrameWorx.DTO.UserInput)
member.summary: Creates an Event
member.param: A UserInput object containing the data with which to create the Event
member.returns: An HTTP Status code of 201 (Created) upon success, with the Location response header set to the location of the newly created Event (the GET resource).

member.name: M:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Areas.API.Controllers.EventController.Delete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes an Event.

member.name: T:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Areas.API.Controllers.SystemController

member.name: M:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Areas.API.Controllers.SystemController.PostRetrieveAuthToken(RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Areas.API.Models.AccountLoginRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves an authorization token for additional calls to the Web API Note, this is a "Post" because using GET for sensitive data is a bad idea for several reasons: 1.) Mostly HTTP referrer leakage (an external image in the target page might leak the password[1]) 2.) Password will be stored in server logs (which is obviously bad) 3.) History caches in browsers
[1] Although I need to note that RFC states that browser should not send referrers from HTTPS to HTTP. But that doesn't mean a bad 3rd party browser toolbar or an external image/flash from an HTTPS site won't leak it. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/323200/is-an-https-query-string-secure
member.param: The request object containing username and password

member.returns: The version number as an integer (string)

member.summary: Retrieves the current Build number. (This value is retrieved from the RainWorx.FrameWorx.BLL dll).
member.returns: The version number as a dotted version number string

member.name: M:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Areas.API.Controllers.MediaController.Post
member.summary:
Creates Media from Request Body.
Accepts MIME multipart content (multipart/form-data) of one or more file "parts", and a single "context" string part. "context" must have a Content-Type of "text/plain", and it's Content-Disposition, "name," must be "context". Media files must have a "filename" in their Content-Dispositions ("name" can be anything).
member.returns: An HTTP Status code of 201 (Created) upon success, WITHOUT the Location response header set. The Response Body contains a List of Media created.

member.name: M:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Controllers.AdminController.ExportUserCSV(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays admin export user csv form
member.param: id of a specific user (0 to skip user id filter)
partial username string to match
partial first name string to match
partial last name string to match
partial email address string to match
filter results by various status flag combinations - see remarks for more info
the name of the role to include (e.g. "Admin", "Seller", or "Buyer"; or empty string ("") to skip role filter)
the name of the column to sort the results by
true to order the results from highest to lowest
previously calculated count of records that will be exported
member.remarks:
valid status values:
empty string ("") IsActive = 1
"deactivated" IsActive = 0
"restricted" IsLockedOut = 1 and IsActive = 1
"unverified" IsVerified = 0 and IsActive = 1
"unapproved" IsApproved = 0 and IsActive = 1
"active" IsActive = 1 and IsLockedOut = 0 and IsVerified = 1 and IsApproved = 1
"newsletter" IsActive = 1 and IsLockedOut = 0 and IsVerified = 1 and IsApproved = 1 and Newsletter = 1

member.name: M:RainWorx.FrameWorx.MVC.Controllers.AdminController.ExportUserCSV(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Processes admin export user csv request
member.param: id of a specific user (0 to skip user id filter)
partial username string to match
partial first name string to match
partial last name string to match
partial email address string to match
filter results by various status flag combinations - see remarks for more info
the name of the role to include (e.g. "Admin", "Seller", or "Buyer"; or empty string ("") to skip role filter)
the name of the column to sort the results by
true to order the results from highest to lowest
true to include a header row in resulting CSV data
a comma-delimited list of columns to include
member.remarks:
valid status values:
empty string ("") IsActive = 1
"deactivated" IsActive = 0
"restricted" IsLockedOut = 1 and IsActive = 1
"unverified" IsVerified = 0 and IsActive = 1
"unapproved" IsApproved = 0 and IsActive = 1
"active" IsActive = 1 and IsLockedOut = 0 and IsVerified = 1 and IsApproved = 1
"newsletter" IsActive = 1 and IsLockedOut = 0 and IsVerified = 1 and IsApproved = 1 and Newsletter = 1
